most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failure due to database errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS failing to launch after updating to version 11.3.0. The issue stems from database corruption or errors during the initial database bootup. Proposed solutions include deleting the database, waiting for the next version with a fix (11.3.1), and engaging in real-time debugging with the Pieces support team.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Antoine (@antoine79) is experiencing issues with Pieces for Developers not launching.
* Mark from Pieces (@mark-at-pieces) believes the issue lies in the initial database bootup.

**Problems identified:**

* Antoine's database seems corrupted despite uninstalling and deleting the relevant folder.
* An error occurs during the initial database bootup, preventing Pieces from launching.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark suggests scheduling a meeting to debug the issue in real-time.
* Antoine expresses willingness to delete the entire database but needs help locating it.
* Mark suggests the fix should be deployed with the next version in approximately 30 minutes.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Antoine will attempt using the new version (11.3.1) with additional logging.
* If the issue persists, Antoine and Mark will further diagnose it during a scheduled call on Wednesday.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation regarding Authentication Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users were experiencing infinite loading when attempting to link their Google or Github account to PiecesOS after the 11.3.0 update.
* The issue occurred both in the Pieces Desktop app and through the PiecesOS toolbar.
* Users were able to access the authentication page, but logging in resulted in an infinite loading screen.
* The problem appeared to be related to a bug in the authentication flow introduced in the recent update.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support team investigated the issue and identified the problem.
* They provided instructions for accessing support logs on Windows to help with debugging.
* The team fixed the bug and confirmed the issue was resolved.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Authentication functionality has been restored and users should now be able to link their accounts successfully.
* Users who continue to experience issues are advised to review their support logs and contact the Pieces support team for further assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue affected multiple users on Windows 11.
* The Pieces team actively addressed the problem and provided regular updates on the progress of the fix.

recommendations: **Prioritize database stability:** Investigate and address the root cause of database errors during Pieces OS launch, particularly after updates. This may involve improving database integrity checks, optimizing database boot-up processes, and ensuring backward compatibility of database structures after updates.

**Enhance authentication flow robustness:** Review and improve the authentication flow to prevent infinite loading issues, especially after updates. Implement robust error handling and user-friendly feedback mechanisms during the authentication process.

**Proactive communication for known issues:** For known critical issues like the authentication bug, establish a proactive communication channel to inform users about the problem, expected resolution time, and potential workarounds. This could involve in-app notifications, status page updates, or social media announcements.

**Analyze support logs for early detection:** Develop automated systems to monitor and analyze support logs for patterns and anomalies. This can help in identifying emerging issues, understanding their impact, and potentially resolving them before they become widespread.

**Improve self-service resources:** Create or update documentation, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides related to database errors and authentication issues. Provide clear instructions on how to gather relevant logs and report issues effectively.
